text: We'll hear argument next in No. 88-1719, Chauffeurs, Teamsters and Helpers v. Terry.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court:
How much are you going to ask for?
--Our damage will be... damages will be measured by what these respondents would have made in... in their wages if they--
--if they had been successful in arbitration.
But no... no other damages and no punitive damages?
At this point there are no other damages involved.
If the employer had not been bankrupt and had still been in the suit, would our analytic problem here today be the same?
I think the answer should be the same.
We did not seek to have that claim for moving expenses struck at the same time we did emotional distress damages and punitive damages.
Well, an attorney's duty is the standard of care.
But the trustee has a similar duty.
The trustee's duty is somewhat different than... than the... than the attorney's.
